text: GraphIQ is an agentic AI system that extracts entities and relations from documents and stores them inside a Neo4j knowledge graph.
The system uses sentence transformer embeddings to encode chunks of text. These embeddings are stored in a FAISS vector index for fast similarity search.
Hybrid retrieval combines vector search and graph evidence from Neo4j to rank chunks relevant to the query.
The entity extraction agent identifies important nodes such as people, organizations, methods, and topics. These nodes are inserted as nodes in the graph.
Relation extraction identifies how two entities are connected. For example, an algorithm may be used by a system or developed by a researcher.
Neo4j stores nodes and relationships in a labeled property graph structure that helps the system perform graph traversal for retrieval.
The embedding agent produces numerical vector representations of text that capture semantic meaning for downstream retrieval.
Using a GPU-accelerated FAISS index allows the retrieval agent to answer queries in milliseconds even on large datasets.
